function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inequality and positionality in urban environments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Struggles to make sense of experience under covid-19 in cities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global spread of contagious diseases like covid-19 in cities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of contagious diseases within the community radio station and podcast production environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases through close contact during podcast interviews and broadcasting activities.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks associated with international travel and interaction with global urban academics and professionals.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inclusion of multiple voices and perspectives in the commentary may lead to the propagation of conflicting information about covid-19.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"International mobility of scholars increases the risk of spreading contagious diseases across borders.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid production and dissemination of the podcast project may amplify awareness of the impact of the covid-19 pandemic on cities, but may also spread misinformation or panic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Iterative collaboration and sharing of the critical commentary may facilitate the exchange of ideas and insights but also increase the risk of exposure to the virus during in-person discussions or gatherings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prevalence of depression and ptsd among quarantined people during the covid-19 outbreak","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Burden of the pandemic and prevalence of mental health problems","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prevalence of symptoms of anxiety, depression, and trauma related to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Vulnerability of certain groups to mental health disturbances during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on unreliable or overwhelming information sources for pandemic-related information dissemination.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Prevalence of psychological problems and associated factors during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Studies related to the pandemic may have limitations due to the sars-cov-2 outbreak, impacting the randomization of the sample.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Online surveys as the main method of information collection may trigger biases in participant selection, such as oversampling of certain demographics.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of specific populations in review studies may lead to the oversight of key findings related to vulnerable and underrepresented communities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clear and direct information policies on pandemic management","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low quality and veracity of internet information","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to specific recommendations and official sources on the internet and media","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing fake news, conspiracy theories, and magic cures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excessive access to information leading to an ’infodemic’","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Factors associated with mental health disturbances , gender, age, income, social networks","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Young people between 18 and 30 are the most psychologically affected by the pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of income during the covid-19 crisis is associated with poor mental health.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient information and negative data contribute to high levels of anxiety and stress.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher levels of stress and ptsd associated with gender, age, income, and education","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pandemic-related factors contributing to stress and ptsd","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low-income level contributing to worse mental health","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Marital status and living alone associated with increased depression","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low level of education associated with higher depressive symptoms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High prevalence of anxiety symptoms in the studies range from 8.3% to 81.1%","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in the definition of anxiety and cut-off points in different studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association of anxiety with sociodemographic factors like gender, age, occupation, income, and education","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between demographic factors and mental health issues such as anxiety and depression.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of home confinement and social distancing on the mental health of the general population.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Prevalence of poor mental health due to covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High prevalence of anxiety, depression, and ptsd in the population.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association of anxiety, depression, and ptsd with covid-19 knowledge, economic losses, and concern about infection.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation of anxiety, depression, and ptsd with demographic factors such as gender, age, marital status, and education level.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High levels of anxiety and stress among participants in the study, with specific risk factors related to age, sex, income, education, and health status.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Depressive symptoms, anxiety, and ptsd reported among a significant percentage of participants, with associations to sex, mental health history, and exposure to the virus.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in mental health outcomes based on age, sex, marital status, and spiritual well-being, with varying levels of risk and protective factors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious disease spread due to close contact in confined spaces and lack of physical distancing measures","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological impact of restrictive measures and social isolation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Gender disparities in anxiety and depression","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential risk of bias in the selection and evaluation of studies due to the involvement of multiple evaluators","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete or inadequate reporting of study characteristics and results","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
